root: ^Paige: I wasn’t sure I mentioned that earlier.
^Paige: I was thinking to myself that maybe I had but...
^Paige: I figured I should tell you AGAIN!
^Rhodes: I'm not really into this type of music.

Song_Starts: ^Rhodes: I had a poster of them in my room!
Alex_01: ^Paige: They’re only the biggest underground indie mainstream artist in existence!
Song_Playing_01: ^Paige: Wow, it’s weird to hear this song on the radio these days!
^Paige: I heard they had a nasty breakup.
^Paige: Each band member went their separate ways, and they don’t talk anymore.
^Paige: They’re all doing wildly different music now!
Axel_Gant: ^Paige: I don’t think they’ve released many songs since.
^Paige: They stealth-dropped a song called PLUNDERWALL last year.
^Paige: Turns out a song needs more instruments than just the drums.
Song_Playing_02: ^Paige: I remember the first time I heard this song.
^Paige: I was with my friends outside this one ice cream parlor with the WEIRDEST flavors.
^Paige: But we were in high school, in our small town by the river.
^Paige: We were quiet for the whole song.
^Paige: Then Gavin goes, “Let’s become a band.”
^Paige: And what Gavin said, we did.
^Paige: We got a bunch of secondhand instruments.
^Paige: Gavin already had a mic and guitar.
^Paige: Then, we found Lyle’s keyboard on the side of the road.
^Paige: Jasmine’s drum set was harder to get though.
^Paige: We did odd jobs for five months until we scraped together enough money to buy the cheapest set.
^Paige: And my bass, I stole from my cousin.
^Paige: We would meet every day that summer.
^Paige: And we’d make a bunch of noise from sunrise to sunset.
^Paige: Gavin’s mom would bring us ice pops.
^Paige: Those were the only times we stopped playing.
^Paige: Maybe that’s why Gavin’s mom brought us so many ice pops.
^Paige: But we dreamed we’d play at MAXINE’S BIBLIOTHEQUE by senior year.
^Paige: We just had to get good enough.
^Paige: And the only way to get good was to keep playing.
^Paige: Then summer ended, and Lyle’s mom got a new job in the big city, far from the river.
^Paige: And Jasmine flunked too many classes and had to focus on her exams.
^Paige: “And you can’t have a band without percussion!”
^Paige: At least that’s what Gavin said.
^Paige: And what Gavin said, I did.
^Paige: You ever been in a band?
^Rhodes: I tried to make one with my friends in highschool. We lasted two days.
^Rhodes: Yea, but it was always just me alone in my bedroom.
Story_End: ^Paige: Yeah. I’m not sure it’s worth it.
